messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] alleged ageist rules
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/8/02 11:37:11 PM Pacific Standard Time, SandraDodd@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/8/02 11:37:11 PM Pacific Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

<< She's a good
swimmer, and she can read well enough for me to leave her changes of plans
in
writing.
>>

The pool is THE social place <G> When my kids got tired of the workshops
and game room, they could be found in the pool. There is a few groups of
young girls running around. My dd doesn't know what to do for the talent
show, but my son is going to do his pogo stick!

Kathy

messages.subject: alleged ageist rules
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/8/02 10:59:24 PM, PSoroosh@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/8/02 10:59:24 PM, PSoroosh@... writes:

<< We now state officially that kids should be accompanied by a
responsible adult at all times. Then we leave it up to the responsible ADULTS
to decide what that means in their own individual case. Some kids are fine on
their own. >>

I'm used to SCA events where everyone there is in the organization. There
will be an aspect of that here, but more outsiders, too. As crowded as it
will be, I doubt anyone would get Holly away and alone from other people so I
can't foresee any concerns. If we have a meeting place (like maybe our ROOM
if it's not two buildings away and in a parking lot, or a place near the
speaker's table or somewhere Holly would feel comfortable hanging out) and if
she knows which rooms my workshops are in, she'll be okay. She's a good
swimmer, and she can read well enough for me to leave her changes of plans in
writing.

Holly's saying she's too shy for the talent show. I don't really think so,
but maybe.

I know I'm not too shy!! <g> I'll probably get her to do something with me,
or maybe I'll be her accompanist (on guitar, or recorder, or vocal duet or
some such).

Sandra
